intro: Kefersteinia lehmannii, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is adapted to rocky or mountainous environments. Kefersteinia lehmannii is often found in coastal and inland fynbos vegetation types.
